strategy: Apply a deep neural network (DNN) with a multi-layer perceptron architecture to model non-linear relationships in the data. Instead of relying on tree-based models, use dense layers with ReLU activations and incorporate one-hot encoded categorical features (e.g., 'Sex', 'Embarked') directly into the input. Introduce a novel feature: the logarithm of the passenger fare (log(Fare)) combined with the number of parents/children (Parch) to capture socioeconomic dynamics. Use dropout layers for regularization and normalize inputs via batch normalization. Train using early stopping on a stratified validation set to prevent overfitting.

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import StratifiedKFold
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler, LabelEncoder
from tensorflow.keras.models import Sequential
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dense, Dropout, BatchNormalization
from tensorflow.keras.optimizers import Adam
from tensorflow.keras.callbacks import EarlyStopping
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Create novel feature: log(Fare) + Parch
X_train['Log_Fare'] = np.log1p(X_train['Fare'])
X_train['Fare_Parch'] = X_train['Log_Fare'] * X_train['Parch']
X_test['Log_Fare'] = np.log1p(X_test['Fare'])
X_test['Fare_Parch'] = X_test['Log_Fare'] * X_test['Parch']

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_cols = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)

# Align columns
common_cols = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_cols]
X_test = X_test[common_cols]

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Build and train DNN model
model = Sequential([
    Dense(128, activation='relu', input_shape=(X_train_scaled.shape[1],)),
    BatchNormalization(),
    Dropout(0.3),
    
    Dense(64, activation='relu'),
    BatchNormalization(),
    Drop

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from tensorflow.keras.models import Sequential
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dense, Dropout, BatchNormalization
from tensorflow.keras.optimizers import Adam
from tensorflow.keras.callbacks import EarlyStopping

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Create novel feature: log(Fare) + Parch
X_train['Log_Fare'] = np.log1p(X_train['Fare'])
X_train['Fare_Parch'] = X_train['Log_Fare'] * X_train['Parch']
X_test['Log_Fare'] = np.log1p(X_test['Fare'])
X_test['Fare_Parch'] = X_test['Log_Fare'] * X_test['Parch']

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_cols = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)

# Align columns
common_cols = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_cols]
X_test = X_test[common_cols]

# Normalize features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

# Build and train DNN model
model = Sequential([
    Dense(128, activation='relu', input_shape=(X_train_scaled.shape[1],)),
    BatchNormalization(),
    Dropout(0.3),
    
    Dense(64, activation='relu'),
    BatchNormalization(),
    Dropout(0.3),
    
    Dense(32, activation='relu'),
    Dropout(0.2),
    
    Dense(1, activation='sigmoid')
])

model

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from tensorflow.keras.models import Sequential
from tensorflow.keras.layers import Dense, Dropout, BatchNormalization
from tensorflow.keras.optimizers import Adam

# Load data

test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target

y_train = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

X_train['Fare_Parch'] = X_train['Log_Fare'] * X_train['Parch']
X_test['Log_Fare'] = np.log1p(X_test['Fare'])
X_test['Fare_Parch'] = X_test['Log_Fare'] * X_test['Parch']

X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)

# Align columns

X_train = X_train[common_cols]
X_test = X_test[common_cols]

# Normalize features

X_train_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)

    Dense(128, activation='relu', input_shape=(X_train_scaled.shape[1],)),

    Dropout(0.2),
    
    Dense(1, activation='sigmoid')
])

import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y_train = train_df['Survived']

X_test = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
X_train['Age'].fillna(X_train['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Age'].fillna(X_test['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Create novel feature: log(Fare) + Parch
X_train['Log_Fare'] = np.log1p(X_train['Fare'])
X_train['Fare_Parch'] = X_train['Log_Fare'] * X_train['Parch']
X_test['Log_Fare'] = np.log1p(X_test['Fare'])
X_test['Fare_Parch'] = X_test['Log_Fare'] * X_test['Parch']

# One-hot encode categorical features
categorical_cols = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
X_train = pd.get_dummies(X_train, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)
X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)

# Align columns
common_cols = X_train.columns.intersection(X_test.columns)
X_train = X_train[common_cols]
X_test = X_test[common_cols]

# Create submission (baseline for now)
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': y_train.mean()  # Fallback to baseline
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

# Separate features and target

X_train['Fare'].fillna(X_train['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

X_test['Fare'].fillna(X_test['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

X_test['Log_Fare'] = np.log1p(X_test['Fare'])
X_test['Fare_Parch'] = X_test['Log_Fare'] * X_test['Parch']

# One-hot encode categorical features

X_test = pd.get_dummies(X_test, columns=categorical_cols, drop_first=True)
